body:
Thomas Seebohm wrote:
> 
> After trying to run rshow with a 70MB octree created in Radiance, rshow
> failed with the following message: "out of tree space memory in gettree". A
> smaller octree of an order of magnitude smaller posed no problem for rshow.
> A processor on our SGI system has a 1 GB of memory. Is this a problem we can
> fix or does it require a change in gettree?
The Open-GL rshow is quite memory hungry (using Open-GL display lists)
but 70MB on 1GB machine should be expected to run. Any images/instances
loaded with the main octree ? What does 'top' or 'grosview' say while
rshow starts up ?
-Peter
